info.name: Magic Weapons
info.description: Some magic weapons, unique weapons and enchantments used on the planet Fauldis.
info.author: Nick Vendel

description.p:
This magical sword with straight, marble-like white, stone blade is a relic of forgotten times. Name "Justice" was first mentioned for this sword in ancient Human books, it's said that sword makes those who wield it more heroic, fair, just and overall good.
Even though Justice was mainly spotted throughout the history in the hands of heroes and fair rulers, there can be found some examples of those who history remembers as tyrants and usurpers.
When user isn't attuned to Justice, it has following properties:
Aged. This weapon had more than a century of being unused and became charged with natural magical energy. It becomes magical and gains +1 enchantment bonus to attack rolls.
When creature attunes to Justice in its primal form, sword reactivates its additional properties:
Presence. The Justice has unnatural aura that affects it's user. This aura has limited sentience, mostly reacting to specific triggers or acting in accord to it's instincts.
This presence can't communicate, see or hear, but it reacts to emotions of it's user and those around him.

Instinctive Behavior. Presence within the sword affects mind of the user and can completely change it's behavior. Presence forces those who attuned to the sword to protect the weak, to tell the truth, to follow the law of the land, to be fair and just. When user tries to do something that goes against one or more of those behaviors, it must make Wisdom saving throw against DC15, on a fail, user changes his mind and decides to act in accord to sword's will. In addition, user must make the same saving throw when trying to give sword to someone else, when trying to throw it away or when trying to end attunement with it, on fail user changes his mind, and cannot repeat any of these actions until next midday.

Honest. Sword despises deception and unfair play, because of this blade rejects poison and acid. Whenever you try to apply poison or acid to the blade, it's unaffected and dose of the liquid is wasted.

Righteous Cause. When wielder protects those in need, Justice shows it's potential. If wielder willingly decides (rather than being forced by the sword) to protect those who can't protect themselves (this includes unconscious allies), blade unleashes it's magical energy and deals additional 1d6 radiant damage.

Enhancement. You feel like this artifact can only grow in power. Justice in primal form, can be enhanced to its original form by a great personal sacrifice for the good cause. It's believed that one of the first users of this weapon gave up his life to protect people, others gave up their noble titles to follow greater cause or sacrificed their reputation when fighting against those in power.

Blade of Light. The sword's blade emits pure white bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet. And you gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this sword.
Sentience. When Justice enhances to ultimate form it gains sentience with an Intellect of 14, Wisdom of 18 and Charisma of 20. It can hear, has normal vision, and a truesight out to a range of 60 ft.
The weapon communicates telepathically with its wielder and can speak, read, and understands all languages that knows its user.

Personality. The entity within the sword believes that user proven himself to be worthy and trusts its wielder to not question his motives or actions, believing them to be always inline with path of benevolence. Sword knows or remembers only information that knows or remembers its current wielder and has the same perspective on any subject as its user, besides subjects of justice or judgement, entity is interested in perspectives of these subjects and thinks that there's ultimately no absolute justice, but people who are forthright and have great empathy for others are the ones who came the closest to have a clear, unclouded judgement.

Additionally, entity is always on guard. Sword will always warn you about magical effects that it can see with its truesight. Additionally, you can't be surprised, except when incapacitated by something other than nonmagical sleep. The weapon magically awakens you, if you are sleeping naturally when combat begins.

Long ago this was a weapon of great warchief who created this blade by crudely melting bronze ore over his stone greatsword in a volcano, he called this new weapon "Conqueror" in hopes that it would help him defeat his enemies.
This massive bronze greatsword can intimidate even those with great physical strength, while its poorly made blade makes it look like it's more of a bludgeoning weapon than a sword, but those who wield it know that with this seemingly useless sword they can become an unstoppable force to be reckoned with.
When user isn't attuned to Conqueror, it has following properties:
Oversized. This weapon requires its user to have Strength of 13 to wield it and gains +1 to damage rolls with it.

Close to Unbreakable. Sword's blade is so thick and strong, that even the most powerful weapons cannot destroy it. Conqueror has immunity to all types of damage, except for fire damage which deals double amount of damage. Once blade suffers 100 points of damage, it starts to endlessly melt and becomes unusable until it's magically repaired via fabricate, or if you use wish spell it will automatically return sword to its original form.
When creature attunes to Conqueror in its primal form, sword reactivates its additional properties:
The Obstacle Destroyer. Whenever you hit an object that isn't worn by a creature with this weapon, you deal additional 2d6 bludgeoning damage.

Enhancement. You feel like this artifact can only grow in power. Conqueror in primal form, can be enhanced to its original form by stealing victory from jaws of defeat. Stories talk about those wielders who came up after falling in battle and because of that they would win the battle, they also talk about those who lose their control or temperate only to regain it once again in a critical moment, weapon will react to user's display of will power.

It becomes magical and gains +1 enchantment bonus to attack and damage rolls. This weapon no longer requires its user to have Strength of 13 to wield it, it seems as light as any other greatsword.

Close to Unbreakable. Sword's blade is so thick and strong, that even the most powerful weapons cannot destroy it. Conqueror has immunity to all types of damage, except for fire damage which deals normal amount of damage.

Degradation. This artifact has weakness to fire and heat. Once Conqueror in its original form suffers 150 points of damage, it starts to glow from intense heat and becomes unstable, if it isn't magically repaired with either fabricate or wish spell, next time it's hit with fire damage, magic of the blade disperses and sword degrades to its primal form.
When creature attunes to Conqueror in its original form, sword reactivates its additional properties:
The Obstacle Destroyer. Whenever you hit an object that isn't worn by a creature with this weapon, you deal additional 2d6 bludgeoning damage.
Conqueror's Charge. The sword has 4 charges and regains 1d4 expanded charges daily at dawn. You can expend 1 or more charges to use one of the following abilities:

ul.li: Tremor Blow. When attacking a creature you can choose to use this ability instead of your normal attack with this weapon by spending 1 charge. On hit, you strike target with blunt side of the blade that causes violent vibrations inside its body dealing normal amount of damage that is then transformed into a bludgeoning type, and if the target is Medium or smaller, pushing it 5 feet back. Target then must succeed on Constitution saving throw against DC12 or lose it's balance and fall prone.

Backlash Block. When creature hits you with a weapon attack, you can use your Reaction and expend 2 charges to block that attack. When you do so, the damage you take from the attack is reduced by 2d6 and you deal this amount of damage back to the weapon you blocked.

Strike of Resonance. When you hit a creature that is wearing metal armor or is partially or completely made of metal, you can expend 2 charges to use this ability. You deal normal amount of damage with your strike, that creates resonance within the metal which bends it and damages the creature, dealing additional 2d6 bludgeoning damage that can't be reduced by a resistance and target must make a Constitution saving throw against DC12. On a failed save, target receives 2d6 bludgeoning damage that can't be reduced by a resistance at the start of its turn. It repeats saving throw at the end of its turn, ending effect on a success.

History has rare mentions of this step, sword can go through suffering massive amount of damage or defeating dangerous opponents with blade at its weakest, can cause transformation to take place.

On hit, you strike target with blunt side of the blade that causes violent vibrations inside its body dealing normal amount of damage that is then transformed into a bludgeoning type, and pushing it 15 feet back. Target then must succeed on Constitution saving throw against DC18 or lose it's balance and fall prone.

Scorching Blade. You can use Bonus action and expend 1 charge to heat the blade glowing hot. You pierce the earth with your blade, small lava fissure opens and engulfs it, when you retract the sword its blade glows with bright yellow color that sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet, and deals additional 3d6 fire damage. These effects end after 1 hour.

Backlash Block. When creature hits you with a weapon attack, you can use your Reaction and expend 2 charges to block that attack. When you do so, the damage you take from the attack is reduced by 3d6 + your Strength modifier and you deal this amount of damage back to the weapon you blocked.

Strike of Resonance. When you hit a creature that is wearing metal armor or is partially or completely made of metal, you can expend 2 charges to use this ability. You deal normal amount of damage with your strike, that creates resonance within the metal which bends it and damages the creature, dealing additional 2d6 bludgeoning damage that can't be reduced by a resistance and target must make a Constitution saving throw against DC18. On a failed save, target receives 5d6 bludgeoning damage that can't be reduced by a resistance at the start of its turn. It repeats saving throw at the end of its turn, ending effect on a success.

Crushing Wave. When you hit a creature with Conqueror you can expend 3 charges to use this ability. You deal normal damage to the target of the attack, which creates devastating vibration in the air that tears and crushes it and those behind it, each creature in a 15-foot cube originating from you must make a Constitution saving throw against DC18. On a failed save, a creature takes 4d8 bludgeoning damage that can't be reduced by a resistance and has its speed halved until the end of your next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and its speed is unaffected.

Magma Geyser. You use your action to pierce the ground with the blade and expend 3 charges, a fissure opens and fountain of magma and fire erupts in a 20-foot cube centered on that point. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw against DC18. A creature takes 5d8 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Additionally, the ground in that area becomes difficult terrain for 1 hour.

Overwhelming Attack. You can expend 4 charges and replace one of your weapon attacks with this ability. On hit, you deal normal amount of damage with your strike, that creates powerful tremor within the target's body. Target then must succeed on Constitution saving throw against DC18 or be stunned until the end of your next turn.

Seismic Strike. You use your action to strike the ground and expend 5 charges, creating a burst of seismic activity around you. Each creature you choose within 30 feet of you must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against DC18 or take 5d6 bludgeoning damage and fall prone. A creature that succeeds on its saving throw takes half as much damage and doesn't fall prone.

Planet-Shaping Earth. You use your action to strike the ground and expend 8 charges, kinetic energy blasts through the earth and creates destructive earthquake. This ability allows you to use unique version of earthquake spell. When you cast spell in this way, its duration becomes 30 seconds (5 rounds) and doesn't require concentration but still forces DC18 Dexterity saving throw each round, the spell is centered on you, you're able to select concentrating creatures who must make DC18 Constitution saving throw. You're unaffected by this spell and difficult terrain that it creates. Effects of this ability can't be dispelled.

Planet-Forging Fire. You use your action to strike the ground and expend 9 charges, to create burst of intense heat and blazing fire that engulfs everything in it's way. Each creature that you choose in a 100-foot-radius sphere centered on you must make a DC18 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 10d10 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

description.p:
It is believed that this recurved bow was one of the first longbows in human history. Carvings that were carefully made on its wooden limbs represent hunters, woodland creatures and interactions between man and nature. It was made out of incredibly hard darkwood, that could withstand almost impossible force, but would still bend to apply immense force to a shot.
Creation of this weapon is a mystery, but it's theorized that wood used in creation was living darkwood, potentially part of conscious creature that imbued weapon with its unique properties.
When user isn't attuned to Darkwood's Memory, it has following properties:

Natural Resistance. Longbow's darkwood has unique innate resistance to bludgeoning and slashing damage and it's immune to any kind of piercing damage. Additionally, it has 40 hit point maximum and regains 1d4 hit points each midnight.
When creature attunes to Darkwood's Memory in its primal form, bow reactivates its additional properties:

Eyes of the Woods. When targeting creature with this longbow, you can ignore any plant-based half or three quarters cover, including high grass, wines, bushes, trees and other naturally produces flora.

Enhancement. You feel like this artifact can only grow in power. Darkwood's Memory in primal form, can be enhanced to its original form by killing worthy prey, preferably from a great distance. A worthy pray can be a greater enemy of the group, personal foe on your quest or even regular animal when you struggling to survive, this ritual summons primal hunter instincts, and allowing user to wield the bow as if it was natural part of them.

Natural Magic. This weapon had more than a century of being unused and became charged with natural magical energy. It becomes magical and gains +1 enchantment bonus to attack and damage rolls.

Degradation. This artifact can lose it's powers by magical means. Darkwood's Memory bow in its original form, can only degrade to primal form by a wish spell, or blight spell casted at 5th level but in that case caster must make a check with its spellcasting ability against DC20 to succeed.
When creature attunes to Darkwood's Memory in its original form, bow reactivates its additional properties:

Longshot. You can strike distant targets with increased accuracy. Once per turn, you can replace one of your attacks with a Darkwood's Memory ranged attack that doesn't impose disadvantage from distance when your target is within bow's long range.

Nature's Knowledge. By touching a tree with bow's limb, you instantly gain knowledge about events that transpired within the 1 mile area in the past day, gaining information about creatures that have passed through, weather, and other circumstances. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.
Additionally, you're unaffected by nonmagical plant-based difficult terrain.

Enhancement. You feel like this artifact can grow further in power. Darkwood's Memory in original form, can be enhanced to its superior form by gaining a deeper understanding of natural world around you. Throughout the time, historians and druids debate on what is and how can you obtain such understanding, while druids say that users need to acknowledge forces of nature and be in their favor, before unleashing weapon's potential, historians point out those wielders who can be called enemies of nature, those who encouraged changes to the natural world and its processes, yet still were able to achieve next form of this weapon.

ul.li: Your Armor Class becomes 20, if it wasn't equal or higher already.
